de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep
Interface BigStepProofRule

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<ProofRule>, ProofRule
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBigStepProofRule
public interface BigStepProofRule
extends ProofRule

Base interface for the proof rules used within the big step interpreter. This interface is very similar to the TypeCheckerProofRule used within the type checker.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
ProofRule

Method Detail

apply

void apply(BigStepProofContext context,
           BigStepProofNode node)
           throws ProofRuleException
Applies this big step proof rule to the specified node via the given context.

Parameters:
context - the big step proof context via which the application of this rule to the node should be performed.
node - the big step proof node to which to apply this rule.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either context or node is null.
ProofRuleException - if this rule cannot be applied to the node.

update

void update(BigStepProofContext context,
            BigStepProofNode node)
Updates the specified node as part of a previous rule application for context. This method is only interesting for non-axiom rules, like (APP) or (LET), that need to update their created proof nodes even after applications of other proof rules to subtrees.

Parameters:
context - the main proof context, which was previously specified as parameter to an apply(BigStepProofContext, BigStepProofNode) invokation on another proof node, possibly with another proof rule.
node - the BigStepProofNode that may need to be updated.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if context or node is null.
